Review of The Neuroscience of Creativity with Dr Pinar Oztop Rebecca Harrison - Level I


Rebecca writes...Dr. Pinar Oztop gave an engaging talk at SeedTalk about the neuroscience of creativity. She shared insights on the history and definition of creativity, covering its psychological aspects and her research findings. Dr. Oztop explained how factors like cognitive functions, motivation, personality traits, and mood influence creativity. She also demonstrated the Torrance Tests of Creative Thinking, allowing the audience to participate and understand its workings. Using real-life examples, she made her points clearer. Additionally, she recommended books and articles for further reading. Overall, her talk was interesting not only to psychology students but also to those studying art and creative writing, as well as the general audience.

Address

Department of Psychology, Liverpool Hope University, Hope Park, Liverpool, L16 9JD
